<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Four-Ways Dogslicer](/Equipment.aspx?ID=733)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=27" />
<trait label="Electricity" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=56" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 261 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Price** 1,700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Dogslicer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=49)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This _+2 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [dogslicer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=49)_ is obviously the work of a brilliant but scrappy artisan who valued versatility over safety. Four toothy gems line the blade's cutting edge, three of which glow—one with fiery red light, one with a chill blue, and one that gives off sparks—while the last is a glistening black. Each of these gems embodies a weapon property rune, but only one rune can be active at a time.

<document level="2" id="action-579" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Four-Ways Dogslicer
